{"step_by_step_thinking": "The investigator is studying the association between a binary independent variable (maternal intake of iron supplements: Yes or No) and a continuous dependent variable (birth weights of new born babies in gm). The appropriate statistical test for this situation would be a test that compares the means of two independent groups. The Chi-square test is used for categorical variables, and the Analysis of variance is used when there are more than two groups to compare. The Student t-test is used to compare the means of two groups, but it's more specific form, the independent or unpaired t-test, is used when the two groups are independent of each other, which is the case in this situation.", "answer_choice": "B"}
